page.title: 07SMEATHARPE-OUR HOMES
page.content: Many of the houses in Smeatharpe are old cottages and the remainder are fairly new bungalows. All of the houses have electricity, mains water and septic sewage tanks. There is no piped gas but several residents have bottled gas for cooking and heating. Many of the bungalows have oil-fired central heating. Many homes have oil or solid fuel Raeburn or Aga stoves, which are something of an institution in the country kitchen. Many cottages still have open fires or modern wood- burning stoves. Almost all the residents have a tele- phone, refridgerator, deep-freeze, washing machine, electric or gas cooker, television, radio, stereo music-centre, car and bicycle. Some also have video-recording machines or micro-computers.
